00:13:26.121 --> 00:13:31.008
All of these exercises, as I've already
said, are based on your case studies.

226
00:13:31.008 --> 00:13:36.597
So the answer to these exercises are
either to be found in the case study or

227
00:13:36.597 --> 00:13:38.900
to be found in your ITIL book.

228
00:13:38.900 --> 00:13:43.973
You're going to get your templates
from your ITIL book, but you're going

229
00:13:43.973 --> 00:13:48.654
to get the answers, the information,
the meat to go on those bones.

230
00:13:48.654 --> 00:13:51.718
Everything that needs to
be in those templates,

231
00:13:51.718 --> 00:13:56.576
you're gonna find from your case study,
or maybe from previous questions,

232
00:13:56.576 --> 00:13:59.580
because each exercise
builds on the previous.

233
00:14:00.700 --> 00:14:02.860
Then we've got
the Training Needs Analysis.

234
00:14:02.860 --> 00:14:06.128
Again, the template for
which you're gonna find in your ITIL book.

235
00:14:06.128 --> 00:14:09.302
And you need to complete
the training needs analysis for

236
00:14:09.302 --> 00:14:13.500
all of the stakeholders that you've
identified in a previous exercise.

237
00:14:13.500 --> 00:14:16.870
And you'll need to complete that for
this particular project.

238
00:14:16.870 --> 00:14:18.941
And that's gonna take
you about 30 minutes.

239
00:14:18.941 --> 00:14:23.300
And then we're going to be creating
a Stakeholder Communication Plan.

240
00:14:23.300 --> 00:14:27.140
So planning your communication for
this particular project,

241
00:14:28.300 --> 00:14:33.410
your communication to everybody
that's listed in your case study that

242
00:14:33.410 --> 00:14:38.440
you've identified in your
stakeholder analysis templates.

243
00:14:39.680 --> 00:14:42.413
And then we're going to
define some metrics,

244
00:14:42.413 --> 00:14:45.925
we're gonna define critical
success factors and KPI's.

245
00:14:45.925 --> 00:14:50.545
Using the templates that are again
contained in your ITIL books,

246
00:14:50.545 --> 00:14:54.581
what I need you to do is to
create a balance set of metrics.

247
00:14:54.581 --> 00:14:58.035
So a balance set of CSS and KPI's.

248
00:14:58.035 --> 00:15:00.836
Now I need you to draw on all
the information that we covered

249
00:15:00.836 --> 00:15:03.997
in the two episodes where we looked
at metrics and measurements.

250
00:15:03.997 --> 00:15:08.868
But then you also need to use the CSF
worksheet, and KPI worksheet,

251
00:15:08.868 --> 00:15:13.070
that are identified and
outlined here in your ITIL books.

252
00:15:13.070 --> 00:15:16.820
And taking the information from
our previous exercises, and

253
00:15:16.820 --> 00:15:19.770
from the case study, in order to do that.

254
00:15:19.770 --> 00:15:23.860
And then we're going to complete
a Benefits Realization.

255
00:15:23.860 --> 00:15:25.730
So we're at the end of the project now.

256
00:15:25.730 --> 00:15:27.831
The project's been implemented, and

257
00:15:27.831 --> 00:15:31.148
now I need you to complete
a Benefits Realization worksheet.

258
00:15:31.148 --> 00:15:35.487
In other words, did that project actually
deliver what it was supposed to do?

259
00:15:35.487 --> 00:15:39.927
And this one's going to take you,
again, about 30 minutes to do.

260
00:15:39.927 --> 00:15:44.860
Now, all of these exercises,
they're going to take you some time.

261
00:15:44.860 --> 00:15:47.846
There are a good few hours
worth of exercises here.

262
00:15:47.846 --> 00:15:52.684
And then once you've completed that,
feel free to submit them to us,

263
00:15:52.684 --> 00:15:54.413
contact us by the forum.

264
00:15:54.413 --> 00:15:57.003
Please feel free to submit them to us and

265
00:15:57.003 --> 00:16:00.704
we can evaluate any of
the exercises that you've done.

266
00:16:00.704 --> 00:16:04.034
And then once you've
completed these exercises,

267
00:16:04.034 --> 00:16:06.751
now is the time to take your sample paper.

268
00:16:06.751 --> 00:16:12.049
And in subsequent episodes, we will
be going over the sample paper that

269
00:16:12.049 --> 00:16:17.640
is in the downloadable material and
getting you ready for your real test.

270
00:16:17.640 --> 00:16:18.641
So good luck.

271
00:16:18.641 --> 00:16:20.929
>> All right thank you Jo, for
all that guidance there but

272
00:16:20.929 --> 00:16:23.700
it looks like we have some
work to do on our own now.

273
00:16:23.700 --> 00:16:25.541
So thank you joining us as well.

274
00:16:25.541 --> 00:16:29.136
And get ready for some more
studying material headed your way.

275
00:16:29.136 --> 00:16:30.824
For this show,
we'll go ahead and sign out.

276
00:16:30.824 --> 00:16:32.265
I've been your host, Cherokee Boose.

277
00:16:32.265 --> 00:16:33.151
>> And I'm Jo Peacock.

278
00:16:33.151 --> 00:16:35.976
>> See you next time, here at ITProTV.

279
00:16:35.976 --> 00:16:41.876
[MUSIC]

280
00:16:41.876 --> 00:16:45.083
>> Thank you for watching ITProTV.

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Jo review some of the different techniques and details when sitting for your ITIL Intermediate exam.  They recommend downloading the sample paper for review.  Jo reviews the details on scoring of the exam.  She also has solid exam advice for delegates preparing for an exam.
episodes.title: Exam Review Introduction
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.008 --> 00:00:08.322
Welcome to ITPRO.TV I'm your
host Don Pezet [CROSSTALK].

2
00:00:08.322 --> 00:00:12.204
>> You're watching ITPRO.TV.

3
00:00:12.204 --> 00:00:15.397
>> Welcome to another great
episode right here on ITPRO.TV.

4
00:00:15.397 --> 00:00:18.290
You're watching
the ITIL Practitioner show.

5
00:00:18.290 --> 00:00:22.840
I'm your host, Ronnie Wong and today
we're doing an exam introduction here.

6
00:00:22.840 --> 00:00:26.380
And here to help us out is going to,
well, Miss Jo Peacock.

7
00:00:26.380 --> 00:00:28.600
And she's actually gonna
do a sample paper with us.

8
00:00:28.600 --> 00:00:30.180
So, Jo, welcome to the studios.

9
00:00:30.180 --> 00:00:31.840
>> Thank you very much for
having me, Ronnie.

10
00:00:31.840 --> 00:00:32.860
How are you?

11
00:00:32.860 --> 00:00:33.990
>> I am doing fine, Jo.

12
00:00:33.990 --> 00:00:37.980
Now as we take a look at this sample
paper, It should help us to prepare for

13
00:00:37.980 --> 00:00:39.860
the ITIL practitioner exam.

14
00:00:39.860 --> 00:00:41.430
So Jo, where are we gonna begin?

15
00:00:41.430 --> 00:00:43.982
>> Right, okay, yes you're right,
this is exactly what we want to do.

16
00:00:43.982 --> 00:00:49.084
We just want to prepare for your real
exam, and I just really wanna spend this

17
00:00:49.084 --> 00:00:54.202
session, very, very short session,
just going over some hints and tips.

18
00:00:54.202 --> 00:00:58.577
And what you need to look out for as you
not only prepare to take your sample

19
00:00:58.577 --> 00:01:02.140
paper, but
also prepare to take your real exam.

20
00:01:02.140 --> 00:01:07.320
So let's start off with then, well,
what are the resources that you need?

21
00:01:07.320 --> 00:01:10.690
The resources that you have
actually at your fingertips.

22
00:01:11.700 --> 00:01:17.270
This particular qualification, the ITIL
practitioner qualification is unlike

23
00:01:17.270 --> 00:01:24.460
any of the other ITIL qualifications in
that this particular test is open-book.

24
00:01:24.460 --> 00:01:28.290
It is the only ITIL
test that is open-book.

25
00:01:28.290 --> 00:01:32.320
When I mean open book,
I mean this book here.

26
00:01:32.320 --> 00:01:38.260
This is your purple ITIL Practitioner,
your official ITIL guidance, okay?

27
00:01:38.260 --> 00:01:39.688
It's come from AXELOS,

28
00:01:39.688 --> 00:01:44.186
well actually it says here that it's
property of Her Majesty's Government!

29
00:01:44.186 --> 00:01:46.609
>> Ooh!
>> Okay, it's not even yours.

30
00:01:46.609 --> 00:01:50.160
[LAUGH] It is, it's okay, it's yours.

31
00:01:50.160 --> 00:01:54.300
So this ITL book, well the most useful
thing about this ITL book that you're

32
00:01:54.300 --> 00:01:59.240
going to find certainly during your test,
is going to be section number 7,

33
00:01:59.240 --> 00:02:00.680
and you can see.

34
00:02:00.680 --> 00:02:01.840
And this is your toolkit.

35
00:02:01.840 --> 00:02:05.500
Now remember as we went
through our course.

36
00:02:05.500 --> 00:02:10.940
And as we went through all of the episodes
where we looked at your exercises as well.

37
00:02:10.940 --> 00:02:12.710
Well, here we outlined,

38
00:02:12.710 --> 00:02:17.030
I outlined the tool kit and what was
in the toolkit which was templates.

39
00:02:17.030 --> 00:02:23.289
Lots and lots of templates for you to use
during your test, and also throughout

40
00:02:23.289 --> 00:02:28.560
your real-world experience of ITIL
when you're implementing ITIL as well.

41
00:02:28.560 --> 00:02:33.590
These are templates for all of
the techniques that we looked at, and also

42
00:02:33.590 --> 00:02:39.110
things like the CSI register, and as we've
got here, a KPI worksheet, for instance.

43
00:02:39.110 --> 00:02:41.210
This test is open-book.

44
00:02:41.210 --> 00:02:45.240
Now your sample paper
is open book as well.

45
00:02:45.240 --> 00:02:50.240
I have already given you a warning in the
section where we looked at the exercises.

46
00:02:50.240 --> 00:02:53.480
Now I'll mention it again that in terms

47
00:02:53.480 --> 00:02:58.340
of the official use of your
book during your online test.

48
00:02:59.570 --> 00:03:02.790
Your book should be unmarked, so
please don't make any notes in your book.

49
00:03:02.790 --> 00:03:06.527
There is no guarantee that the proctor
will allow you to use your

50
00:03:06.527 --> 00:03:08.933
book if they see notes within your book.

51
00:03:08.933 --> 00:03:13.168
So I would always as
a recommendation use these tabs,

52
00:03:13.168 --> 00:03:18.260
removable tabs then you can take
them off just before your test.

53
00:03:19.440 --> 00:03:23.040
So your test, and
this applies to your sample test as well,

54
00:03:23.040 --> 00:03:28.161
we're going to start off looking at your
case study, this test is case study based.

55
00:03:28.161 --> 00:03:31.528
And here you have,
in your downloadable material,

56
00:03:31.528 --> 00:03:36.660
it's at the start of your exercises,
you have a copy of the case study.

57
00:03:36.660 --> 00:03:42.730
This is the case study that
will be used during your test.

58
00:03:42.730 --> 00:03:49.050
Now, you can not print off this case
study to use during your real life test.

59
00:03:49.050 --> 00:03:51.950
You can print off this case study
to use during your sample paper.

60
00:03:51.950 --> 00:03:53.860
And obviously I want you to do that.

61
00:03:53.860 --> 00:03:58.150
But, this case study you can not
print off during your real life test.

62
00:03:58.150 --> 00:04:01.829
They will provide you with another
version of that case study.

63
00:04:01.829 --> 00:04:05.431
It'll be exactly the same case study,
but you won't be able to print it off.

64
00:04:05.431 --> 00:04:07.205
And you won't be able to make notes.

65
00:04:07.205 --> 00:04:13.640
So you are not allowed to take
anything printed into your test.

66
00:04:13.640 --> 00:04:16.860
Nothing at all other than this book.

67
00:04:16.860 --> 00:04:19.778
And this book does not
contain the case study.

68
00:04:19.778 --> 00:04:23.546
Now, I've already said this at
the beginning of the exercises and

69
00:04:23.546 --> 00:04:26.250
I'm going to say this again to you,
right now.

70
00:04:27.280 --> 00:04:30.820
Don't forget you're going to have
a case study on your screen.

71
00:04:30.820 --> 00:04:35.520
You're also going to have a question
booklet on your screen in front of you.

72
00:04:35.520 --> 00:04:39.736
You're also going to have an answer
sheet on your screen as well.

73
00:04:39.736 --> 00:04:44.880
That means you have to have three
different Windows opened on your screen.

74
00:04:45.990 --> 00:04:50.160
So if I were you, I'd give myself
a little bit of a head start and

75
00:04:50.160 --> 00:04:53.169
I'd get to know my case
study before my test.

76
00:04:53.169 --> 00:04:56.529
The case study as I've said it's
at the start of the exercises and

77
00:04:56.529 --> 00:04:59.290
it's three pages long at
the start of the exercises.

78
00:04:59.290 --> 00:05:04.130
You have your flow chart that shows
how the company and the subsidiaries

79
00:05:04.130 --> 00:05:09.880
hang together, then you have information
about CruiseAlong cars and DriveYou.com.

80
00:05:09.880 --> 00:05:13.480
And then you have information
about the UOB, and

81
00:05:13.480 --> 00:05:18.250
Global City IT Services,
and NSDOT as well.

82
00:05:18.250 --> 00:05:20.575
Get to know that case study.

83
00:05:20.575 --> 00:05:25.567
Get to know it like the back of your hand,
so then you don't have to refer to it

84
00:05:25.567 --> 00:05:29.710
too much during your test,
the best advice that I can give you.

85
00:05:30.710 --> 00:05:36.184
Your test is two hours and
15 minutes in length.

86
00:05:36.184 --> 00:05:42.280
Your test is 40 questions long,
4-0, not 14, it's 4-0.

87
00:05:42.280 --> 00:05:46.556
Unlike the intermediates that were eight
questions long or MALC that was ten,

88
00:05:46.556 --> 00:05:47.347
this is 40.

89
00:05:47.347 --> 00:05:52.370
Very, very similar to foundation but
that's where the similarity lies.

90
00:05:52.370 --> 00:05:57.056
You will also get at the beginning
of the each what I call section you

91
00:05:57.056 --> 00:05:58.735
will get the attached.

92
00:05:58.735 --> 00:06:01.627
What you can see in front of you now for

93
00:06:01.627 --> 00:06:07.810
every six questions you will have what
we call supplemental information.

94
00:06:07.810 --> 00:06:12.230
See here it says additional
information for questions 1 to 6.

95
00:06:12.230 --> 00:06:19.470
That supplemental information is for
those questions that are mentioned only.

96
00:06:19.470 --> 00:06:22.920
It's not for any other questions.

97
00:06:22.920 --> 00:06:28.089
In this case, it mentions questions
1 to 6, or 1 through to 6.

98
00:06:28.089 --> 00:06:31.880
This supplemental information
is not relevant for

99
00:06:31.880 --> 00:06:35.180
any other questions,
that's incredibly important.

100
00:06:36.980 --> 00:06:40.119
So you will need to refer
to both the case study and

101
00:06:40.119 --> 00:06:44.727
to the supplemental information to
answer questions 1 through to 6.

102
00:06:44.727 --> 00:06:46.946
Now the question format is very,

103
00:06:46.946 --> 00:06:52.030
very similar to the question format
in the ITL foundation material.

104
00:06:52.030 --> 00:06:55.860
However, they're not testing your
ability to be able to remember.

105
00:06:56.870 --> 00:07:01.959
In this particular test, they're testing
your ability to be able to implement ITIL.

106
00:07:01.959 --> 00:07:04.570
They're testing your ability
to be able to improve ITIL.

107
00:07:06.080 --> 00:07:10.260
It's very important that you
understand the objectives and

108
00:07:10.260 --> 00:07:14.740
the purpose of each of your ITIL
processes before you go into this test.

109
00:07:14.740 --> 00:07:19.160
Now we didn't go over these during
ITIL practitioner episodes.

110
00:07:19.160 --> 00:07:22.950
We only went over
the implementation of ITIL.

111
00:07:22.950 --> 00:07:27.720
So I need you in preparation for your test
and in preparation for this sample test to

112
00:07:27.720 --> 00:07:33.090
review your objectives and your purposes
for all of your ITIL processes.

113
00:07:34.340 --> 00:07:38.170
And then doing your test refer to
this additional information, and

114
00:07:38.170 --> 00:07:41.670
refer to the case study as well.

115
00:07:41.670 --> 00:07:45.140
You have two hours and 50 minutes, and
it seems like a huge amount of time.

116
00:07:45.140 --> 00:07:47.480
You think I've got 40 minutes.

117
00:07:47.480 --> 00:07:50.000
So I've got 40 questions and
two hours and 50 minutes.

118
00:07:50.000 --> 00:07:54.180
I've got a huge amount of time,
believe me, it will go very, very quick.

119
00:07:55.390 --> 00:08:00.434
So please make sure that every question is
answered, that you don't leave one blank.

120
00:08:00.434 --> 00:08:02.451
You know if you leave one blank,

121
00:08:02.451 --> 00:08:06.647
then you've got 100% chance of
getting that question wrong.

122
00:08:06.647 --> 00:08:10.364
If you put one answer in there,
even if you're not sure of the answer,

123
00:08:10.364 --> 00:08:14.090
you've got at least a 25% chance
of getting the right answer.

124
00:08:14.090 --> 00:08:18.130
So don't leave anything blank,
use common sense.

125
00:08:18.130 --> 00:08:21.610
There are gonna be some questions
that you're going to have to think.

126
00:08:21.610 --> 00:08:23.530
You're going to have to sit there and

127
00:08:23.530 --> 00:08:27.940
work out the answer,
possibly by process of elimination.

128
00:08:27.940 --> 00:08:29.970
So leave yourself enough time to do that.

129
00:08:29.970 --> 00:08:34.290
If you get to a question where you're
not sure immediately of the answer

130
00:08:34.290 --> 00:08:39.440
move on to the next one and
then come back to that one at the end.

131
00:08:39.440 --> 00:08:43.780
Just make sure that every single
question does have an answer in it.

132
00:08:43.780 --> 00:08:46.180
There are gonna be those that
are going to seem straight forward and

133
00:08:46.180 --> 00:08:51.390
you're going to say,
it really can't be that simple, yes it is.

134
00:08:51.390 --> 00:08:55.050
The ones that seem straight forward,
are straight forward.

135
00:08:55.050 --> 00:08:58.839
Go with your gut instinct and
don't change your answer.

136
00:08:58.839 --> 00:09:03.030
Well over 90% of people that change their
answers, change them to the wrong ones.

137
00:09:03.030 --> 00:09:05.560
So, let's not change any answers, okay.

138
00:09:06.930 --> 00:09:09.650
Read the full question.

139
00:09:09.650 --> 00:09:15.000
Remember my acronym, when it comes to
testing RTFQ, read the full question.

140
00:09:15.000 --> 00:09:18.460
There are no words in those questions
that aren't meant to be there.

141
00:09:18.460 --> 00:09:20.508
So don't try and
skim read through the questions.

142
00:09:20.508 --> 00:09:24.560
Don't try and skip any words,
read the full question.

143
00:09:24.560 --> 00:09:28.520
And as long as you read the full question
and you go with your gut instinct

144
00:09:28.520 --> 00:09:33.590
then you should hit on the right
answer without any problem whatsoever.

145
00:09:33.590 --> 00:09:38.450
Don't try and second guess yourself,
don't try and overcomplicate things,

146
00:09:38.450 --> 00:09:43.630
go with the answer that seems obvious
to you and then at the end of your test

147
00:09:43.630 --> 00:09:47.130
then you simply when you're doing your
live test you click on submit and

148
00:09:47.130 --> 00:09:49.330
you can submit your test.

149
00:09:49.330 --> 00:09:54.082
Or as soon as you finish your sample paper
then I would like you to tune back in and

150
00:09:54.082 --> 00:09:58.979
to watch the episode on the exam review
well we'll spend a couple of episodes just

151
00:09:58.979 --> 00:10:00.871
going over all the questions.

152
00:10:00.871 --> 00:10:05.250
And why they are the relevant answers
the correct answers to those particular

153
00:10:05.250 --> 00:10:06.310
questions.

154
00:10:06.310 --> 00:10:10.990
But for now what I am going to say
to you is print off your case study,

155
00:10:10.990 --> 00:10:16.400
make sure that you read
the supplemental information at

156
00:10:16.400 --> 00:10:21.830
the top of each section and
check what questions it's relevant for.

157
00:10:23.580 --> 00:10:28.250
Make sure that you have your
book to hand and good luck.

158
00:10:28.250 --> 00:10:32.280
And I'll see you in the next episode when
we're going to review how you went on.

159
00:10:33.700 --> 00:10:36.300
>> All right Joe, thank you again for
helping us at least,

160
00:10:36.300 --> 00:10:38.426
to get everything situated in our mind.

161
00:10:38.426 --> 00:10:41.787
And to emphasize the fact that,
knowing that case study is gonna be

162
00:10:41.787 --> 00:10:45.928
the most beneficial thing that we can do
right now, as we get ready to prepare, and

163
00:10:45.928 --> 00:10:48.828
to do not only the sampling paper,
but also for the exam.

164
00:10:48.828 --> 00:10:51.664
It's a great place to also
end this episode then,
